column1: "best_practice": "The spectra for each sample should be concatenated into [[http://wiki.dataseer.io/doku.php?id=data_type:tabular_data|tabular data]]. The table should list the dilution factor and other loading data for each sample. A separate .txt file should provide detailed information on the machine itself
column5: and the settings used during sample collection."

column1: "best_practice": "There are many considerations when sharing human clinical or demographic data. Of primary concern are issues around consent and identifiability. Ideally
column2: consent for data sharing is obtained from participants before data collection occurs. If the study design does not involve consenting new participants
column3: then ethics board approval needs to be sought with respect to sharing data without consent. Careful de-identification (removal of personally identifying data such as birthdates) and/or anonymization needs to happen prior to sharing or deposition in a repository. Consultation with your ethics review board is required to determine what level of de-identification or anonymization is needed in your specific case. However
column4: here are some basic guidelines (from https://irb.ucsf.edu/definitions#18) for data from the USA
column5: although these are likely applicable in other jurisdictions:"

column1: "description": "Clinical and/or demographic data at an individual participant level that is either a stand-alone dataset
column2: or is associated with another method of data collection (eg. genomics). Data are usually kept in tabular databases
column3: eg in Excel or in a text file format (.csv.)"

column1: "best_practice": "A very thorough data dictionary is needed to accompany the data set to explain any data coding
column3: or other calculations. Column headings should describe the content of each column and contain only numbers
column5: and underscores \u2013 no spaces
column6: or special characters. Lowercase letters are preferred. Row names should be consistent with those used in the article and in other related datasets."

column1: "best_practice": "Online survey tools typically export to .csv (or Microsoft Excel that can be saved as a .csv file). Column headings should describe the content of each column and contain only numbers
column4: or special characters. Lowercase letters are preferred. Row names should be consistent with those used in the article and in other related datasets."

"description": "A microanalytical technique combining mass spectrometry and gas chromatography for the qualitative as well as quantitative determinations of compounds."

"description": "A mass spectrometric technique that is used for the analysis of large biomolecules. Analyte molecules are embedded in an excess matrix of small organic molecules that show a high resonant absorption at the laser wavelength used. The matrix absorbs the laser energy
column2: thus inducing a soft disintegration of the sample-matrix mixture into free (gas phase) matrix and analyte molecules and molecular ions. In general
column3: only molecular ions of the analyte molecules are produced
column4: and almost no fragmentation occurs. This makes the method well suited for molecular weight determinations and mixture analysis."

column1: "description": "An analytical method used in determining the identity of a chemical based on its mass using mass analyzers/mass spectrometers."
